Community Tips

Take Advantage of CLE Courses

Take advantage of our growing library of on-demand and live, online CLE courses, courtesy of your Justia Connect Pro membership! We presently offer courses accredited in California, Texas, and South Carolina, and continue to expand our list to include more jurisdictions. Lawyers may also pursue CLE credit in additional jurisdictions via applicable self-submission and reciprocity policies.

Justia Webinars

Upcoming Presentations
Free Law: Resources, Technology & Legal Issues (Past, Present & Future)

Recent studies have shown that there has been a dramatic increase in impairment due to alcoholism, addiction, and mental health disorders among members of the legal profession. What role does an always-connected society and technology play in this phenomenon? Explore this question in our upcoming webinar led by Brian S. Quinn of Lawyers Concerned for Lawyers of Pennsylvania. Please note this webinar is approved for one hour of California Competence Issues MCLE credit.

Register Now

Recent Recordings
The Addicted Lawyer. How We Got Here. Where We Are Headed.

Substance use disorders in the legal community are a well-known issue that can substantially impair an attorneyâ€™s ability to practice law and adhere to professional obligations. In this CLE-accredited webinar, Brian Cuban explores the impacts of mental health and recovery in the legal profession. Please note this program is accredited for one hour of Prevention and Detection Competence MCLE credit in California, one hour of Substance Abuse/Mental Health credit in North Carolina, and one hour of Substance Abuse/Mental Health credit in South Carolina (all levels). It has also been submitted to the Texas Commission on MCLE for review of CLE accreditation status.

Justia Deals

Legal Deals

Built by Filevine, Vinesign is a powerful e-signature tool trusted by over 1,500 organizations to easily and securely capture digital signatures. The platform offers text message signature requests, options to leverage customized templates, and upgrades to enable bulk signature requests. As a Justia Connect member, you may be eligible for a 30-day free trial when you create a new Vinesign account!
